;外国投资者 6 月份连续第六个月出售中国债券，尽管亚洲新兴市场根据国际金融研究所 (IIF) 的数据，资金流入强劲。

;

;IIF 公布的初步数据显示，上个月中国债务减免总额为 15.9 亿美元，而 5 月份为 41.9 亿美元IIF 表示，6 月份中国股市有 19.3 亿美元的海外资金流入，而 5 月份的流入额为 1.26 亿美元。

;

;全球金融服务业协会估计，6月份新兴亚洲吸引了海外投资者的135亿美元资金，而拉丁美洲则吸引了67亿美元。

;

;“6月份股市的积极势头有利于资金流大大。 IIF 在报告中表示，再加上未来几个月美国通胀率下降的前景，新兴市场的总体资金流动应该会受益。

;

;周三公布的美国数据显示，消费者价格小幅上涨6 月上涨 3%，这是两年多以来的最小年度涨幅。

;

;但是，尽管消费者价格指数降温，但美联储首选的通胀指标——个人消费支出指数显示，通胀仍高于 2% 的目标。

;

;根据上周发布的美联储官员会议纪要，即使利率放缓，美联储也可能恢复加息行动。

;

;中国第三次降息提振经济，美联储暂停加息

;

;美国央行自去年以来一直在加息以抑制通胀，尽管其坚持了6 月份基准贷款利率在 5% 至 5.25% 之间，结束了自 2022 年 3 月以来的连续 10 次上调

;

;尤其是中国，在人民币贬值压力日益加大的情况下，一直对美国加息保持警惕这可能会导致资金从中国股票和债券上流失。

;

;过去六个月人民币兑美元汇率从 6.7 升至 7.2

;

;中国和亚洲研究主管罗里·格林 (Rory Green)总部位于伦敦的研究公司 TS Lombard 预计，第三季度人民币汇率将升至 1 美元兑 7.35 左右，未来几个月人民币的资金外流压力可能会加大。

;

;“格林上周表示，中国经济复苏弱于预期，加上美国经济出人意料地强劲，是人民币迅速贬值的主要因素。

;

;“中国人民银行既不寻求防止或加剧人民币贬值；事实上，这是经济活动低迷的一个值得欢迎的副产品。干预的重点将是减缓而不是扭转贬值。”

;

;中国人民大学金融学院教授屠永红周四在国有经济日报上发表文章称，中国央行央行需要“密切关注美国货币政策的溢出效应”。

;

;她还表示，中国人民银行应就人民币汇率预期加强与市场的沟通，同时也拓宽了离岸人民币市场的深度和广度。

;

;尽管自去年以来人民币的全球使用有所增加，但格林表示，由于人民币缺乏吸引力，各国持有人民币的意愿较低-

;

;“人民币国际化仍处于早期阶段，但对[美元兑人民币汇率]的影响将越来越大。目前，这是一个值得关注的因素，而不是关键驱动因素，”格林补充道。

;代表电影和电视演员的工会表示尚未与工作室和流媒体达成任何协议服务部门及其领导层将在周四就是否罢工进行投票。

;

;美国演员工会-美国电视和广播艺术家联合会周四早些时候表示，其是否加入已经罢工的编剧的决定将由当天晚些时候召开的一次会议上，领导层表示。宣布这一决定的新闻发布会定于太平洋时间中午举行。

;

;如果演员真的罢工，这将是自 1960 年以来演员和作家首次对影视作品进行罢工。

;

;演员工会发表声明，宣布谈判期限已过，但未签订合同。该声明是在今年艾美奖提名宣布后几个小时发布的，该提名表彰了电视上的最佳作品。

;

;“这些公司拒绝在某些话题上进行有意义的参与，而在其他话题上则完全阻碍了我们。在他们真诚地进行谈判之前，我们无法开始达成协议。”《保姆》的主演、现任演员工会主席弗兰·德雷舍尔 (Fran Drescher) 说道。

;

;代表工作室的组织是“联盟”。电影和电视制片人表示，对未能达成协议感到失望。

;

;“这是联盟的选择，而不是我们的选择。在此过程中，它拒绝了我们提出的历史性的薪酬和剩余增长、大幅提高养老金和健康缴款上限、试镜保护、缩短剧集选择期、保护演员数字肖像的突破性人工智能提案等等的提议，”AMPTP它在一份声明中表示。

;

;它补充说，“SAG-AFTRA 没有继续谈判，而是让我们走上了一条将加深成千上万依赖该行业谋生的人的经济困难的道路。”< /p>;

;好莱坞编剧因工作室谈判失败而罢工

;

;谈判中的问题包括人工智能的不受监管的使用以及近年来出现的流媒体生态系统对剩余报酬的影响。

;

;在连夜写给 SAG-AFTRA 成员的一封信中，德雷舍告诉演员们，在周四董事会投票后准备好去纠察线。

;

;“如你所知，在过去的十年里，流媒体生态系统的崛起严重侵蚀了你的薪酬”，德雷舍尔写道。 “此外，人工智能对创意职业构成了生存威胁，所有演员和表演者都应获得合同语言，以保护他们的身份和才能在未经同意和付费的情况下不被利用”。

;

;演员们与作家一起参加纠察队团结一致排队数周。演员罢工将阻止演员在片场工作或宣传他们的项目。

;

;克里斯托弗·诺兰 (Christopher Nolan) 的电影《奥本海默》(Oppenheimer) 的演员是否参加周四的伦敦首映式可能会影响演员是否罢工 - 尽管美联社正如 Variety 首次报道的那样，确认活动提前了一个小时。

;

;明星马特·达蒙 (Matt Damon) 在周三参加一场摄影活动时表示，虽然每个人都希望避免罢工，但许多演员需要一份公平的合同生存。

;

;“我们应该保护那些处于边缘的人”，达蒙说。 “你每年必须赚 26,000 美元才能获得健康保险。有很多人的剩余付款是他们跨过这个门槛的原因。如果这些剩余付款枯竭，他们的医疗保健也会随之枯竭。这是绝对不能接受的。我们不能这样。所以，我们必须想出一些公平的办法。”

;

;迫在眉睫的罢工给即将到来的第 75 届艾美奖投下了阴影。提名于周三公布，许多提名者都在考虑罢工。

;

;“人们站起来说，‘这实际上行不通，人们需要得到公平的报酬’，”奥斯卡获奖者杰西卡·查斯坦因在《乔治与塔米》中扮演塔米·怀内特而获得第一个艾美奖提名。 “很明显，某些主播确实改变了我们的工作方式和工作方式，而合同确实没有跟上所发生的创新。

;感染 Covid-19 的孕妇面临早产等并发症的风险增加香港大学研究人员的一项联合研究发现，最坏的情况是死产。

;

;引起 Covid-19 的 SARS-CoV-2 病毒会严重扰乱胎盘的发育科技大学（科大）和中文大学（中大）的学者周四表示，对于孕妇，尤其是妊娠晚期的孕妇来说，胎盘是一个血管非常丰富的器官，其形成中大医学院妇产科系主任潘昭仪医生表示，胎盘需要新的血管来支持胎儿的生长。

;

;“胎盘内异常的血管形成胎盘无法提供足够的营养和氧气，会限制胎儿的生长。”

;

;香港研究人员验血可检测鼻咽癌风险

;

;胎盘发育不正常可能会导致先兆子痫（孕妇高血压的一种形式）和妊娠期糖尿病。

;

;先兆子痫可导致中风和早产等严重并发症，每 100 名孕妇中大约有 3 到 5 名患有先兆子痫

;

;胎盘输送的营养和氧气不足，可能会导致胎儿体重过轻、早产，最坏的情况会导致死产。

;

;团队两所大学的研究人员在两年内收集了香港 14 名孕妇的胎盘和子宫壁样本，其中 7 名孕妇在妊娠晚期感染了 Covid-19。

;

;在这 7 名孕妇中，有 5 名显示出 Covid-19 19个症状。受感染的女性年龄在 27 至 42 岁之间，平均在怀孕 35.9 周时被诊断出感染冠状病毒。

;

;虽然 Covid-19 不会直接从母亲传播给胎儿，但研究小组发现病毒感染引发了女性免疫反应的显着增强，从而影响了她的基因活性。

;

;研究小组还发现，受感染的准妈妈体内的妊娠特异性糖蛋白 (PSG) 减少了 70% 以上与未感染的女性相比，其胎盘中的 PSG 基因水平显着降低。

;

;“Covid-19 患者胎盘中的 PSG 基因水平显着较低。众所周知，PSG 基因可以阻止血栓并控制母亲的免疫反应，从而影响胎儿的健康。”香港科技大学表观基因组学研究中心主任 Danny Leung Chi-yeu 说。

;

;这项研究支持美国乔治华盛顿大学之前对 13,000 多名孕妇进行的一项研究结果，该研究发现，感染 SARS-CoV-2 的人面临的死亡风险增加了七倍，而其新生儿面临的死亡风险更高早产和低出生体重的风险。

;

;调查发现，70％的香港新冠受害者有长期后遗症

;

;潘还警告准妈妈们不要拖延他们接种了 Covid-19 疫苗，并强调了病毒预防的重要性。

;

;“怀孕前不愿接种疫苗是一个主要问题。许多女性仍然担心疫苗接种对其怀孕能力的影响，但这尚未得到证实。”她说。

;

;Poon 补充说，接种疫苗的孕妇也会将抗体传递给她们的孕妇。通过脐带给新生儿接种疫苗，保护他们免受 Covid-19 的感染。

;

;“如果您在怀孕期间没有接种疫苗，您的新生儿在头六个月内将不会受到 Covid-19 的保护，因为他们不会产后立即接种疫苗。”

;

;研究发现，长期新冠疫情可能比我们想象的更长、更严重

;

;Poon 还敦促准妈妈们积极自我检测，以便及时接受治疗，即使是这样随着社会摆脱大流行。

;

;“即使在这些病例中，他们没有感染严重的 Covid-19，我们也已经看到母婴界面受到如此严重的影响，更不用说严重的 Covid-19 了。” -19 例，”她说。

;A third member of Hong Kong's key political decision-making body has weighed into discussions over using part of the city's oldest golf course to build public housing and warned against framing the matter as a struggle between the rich and poor.

;

;Executive Council member Ronny Tong Ka-wah on Thursday followed the group's convenor Regina Ip Lau Suk-yee and fellow Jeffrey Lam Kin-fung in urging authorities to reconsider building flats on land to be taken back from the Hong Kong Golf Club.

;

;Tong and Lam are club members, while Ip is a retired member.

;

;He also warned in a commentary for a local newspaper that framing the discussions as a clash between socio-economic classes could serve a political agenda to divide Hong Kong's society, urging the government to be wary of such talk.

;

;Losing control of land will not hurt Hong Kong's chances of hosting major golf events: sources

;

;He argued that the plan to build on the 32 hectares, which will return to government hands in September, was proposed by the previous administration under Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor amid “fears of populist sentiments” stoked by the pro-democracy camp.

;

;At the time, the city had yet to propose any megaprojects to combat the housing shortage, Tong added.

;

;“It was okay to say there was a need for public housing but [the pro-democracy camp] should not have added in colours of hatred against the rich or fostered class division,” he said.

;

;The executive councillor and veteran lawyer denied being privately wealthy and expressed dissatisfaction with critics and local media, accusing them of characterising affluent residents as neglecting the needs of grass roots families.

;

;Asked to respond to Tong's remarks, Secretary for Development Bernadette Linn Hon-ho rejected concerns that the housing plan for the Fanling course was being viewed through the lens of wealth inequality.

;

;“Personally speaking, I will not view the issue from the distinction of social classes and elite. Regardless of the previous and current administration, we are pragmatic. We want to take back the 32 hectares of land,” she said.

;

;Secretary for Culture, Sports and Tourism Kevin Yeung Yun-hung on the same day confirmed authorities from mid-September to mid-November would lend the 32 hectares from the 172-hectare course to organisers of the Aramco Team Series (ATS) and Hong Kong Open golf tournaments in October and November.

;

;The minister did not share future details about the rent agreements reached with the event organisers.

;

;Hong Kong doesn't need another public golf course, development chief says

;

;Yeung also said the land would be designated as a park for residents in December. Authorities to reveal more about the launch next month but had no plans to run a public golf course, he added.

;

;“As long as the situation permits, the government is willing to temporarily lend the land for large-scale golf tournaments. ;

;The club, which hopes to host a leg of the Saudi-backed LIV Golf League tournament next year, said it was willing to help coordinate between the two event organisers and authorities.

;“The government has a mechanism for listening to public opinion. When the opinions do not fit, they say it is populism. It is quite disrespectful to public opinion,” he said.

;US officials have approved the first over-the-counter birth control pill, which will let American women and girls buy contraceptive medication from the same aisle as aspirin and eyedrops.

;

;The Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday that it cleared Perrigo's once-a-day Opill to be sold without a prescription, making it the first such medication in the United States to be moved out from behind the pharmacy counter. The company won't start shipping the pill until early next year, and there will be no age restrictions on sales.

;

;Hormone-based pills have long been the most common form of birth control in the US, used by tens of millions of women since the 1960s. Until now, all of them required a prescription.

;

;Medical societies and women's health groups have pushed for wider access, noting that an estimated 45 per cent of the 6 million annual pregnancies in the US are unintended. Teens and girls, women of colour and those with low incomes report greater hurdles in getting prescriptions and picking them up.

;

;Some of the challenges can include paying for a doctor's visit, getting time off from work and finding child care.

;

;“This is really a transformation in access to contraceptive care”, said Kelly Blanchard, president of Ibis Reproductive Health, a non-profit group that supported the approval. “Hopefully this will help people overcome those barriers that exist now”.

;

;Ireland-based Perrigo did not announce a price. Over-the-counter medicines are generally much cheaper than prescriptions, but they aren't covered by insurance.

;

;US Supreme Court preserves access to abortion pill for now

;

;Many common medications have made the switch to non-prescription status in recent decades, including drugs for pain, heartburn and allergies.

;

;Perrigo submitted years of research to FDA to show that women could understand and follow instructions for using the pill. Thursday's approval came despite some concerns by FDA scientists about the company's results, including whether women with certain underlying medical conditions would understand they shouldn't take the drug.

;

;FDA's action only applies to Opill. It's in an older class of contraceptives, sometimes called mini-pills, that contain a single synthetic hormone and generally carry fewer side effects than more popular combination hormone pills.

;

;But women's health advocates hope the decision will pave the way for more over-the-counter birth control options and, eventually, for abortion pills to do the same.

;

;That said, FDA's decision has no relation to the ongoing court battles over the abortion pill mifepristone. The studies in Perrigo's FDA application began years before the Supreme Court's reversal of Roe v. Wade, which has upended abortion access across the US.

;

;With some states curtailing women's reproductive rights, the FDA has faced pressure from Democratic politicians, health advocates and medical professionals to ease access to birth control. The American Medical Association and the leading professional society for obstetricians and gynaecologists backed Opill's application for over-the-counter status.

;

;An outside panel of FDA advisers unanimously voted in favour of the switch at a hearing in May where dozens of public speakers called for Opill's approval.

;

;Dyvia Huitron was among those who presented, explaining how she has been unable to get prescription birth control more than three years after becoming sexually active. The 19-year-old University of Alabama student said she still isn't comfortable getting a prescription because the school's health system reports medical exams and medications to parents.

;

;“My parents did not let me go on the pill”, Huitron said in a recent interview. “There was just a lot of cultural stigma around being sexually active before you're married”.

;

;While she uses other forms of contraception, “I would have much preferred to have birth control and use these additional methods to ensure that I was being as safe as possible.”

;

;Huitron spoke on behalf of Advocates for Youth, one of the dozens of groups that have pushed to make prescription contraceptives more accessible.

;

;The groups helped fund some of the studies submitted for Opill and they encouraged HRA Pharma, later acquired by Perrigo, to file its application with the FDA.

;

;Advocates were particularly interested in Opill because it raised fewer safety concerns. The pill was first approved in the US five decades ago but hasn't been marketed here since 2005.

;

;“It's been around a long time and we have a large amount of data supporting that this pill is safe and effective for over-the-counter use,” said Blanchard, of Ibsis Reproductive Health.

;

;Male contraceptive pill found 99 per cent effective in mice

;

;Newer birth control pills typically combine two hormones, oestrogen and progestin, which can help make periods lighter and more regular. But their use carries a heightened risk of blood clots and they shouldn't be used by women at risk for heart problems, such as those who smoke and are over 35.

;

;Opill has only progestin, which prevents pregnancy by blocking sperm from reaching the cervix. It must be taken around the same time daily to be most effective.

;

;In its internal review published in May, the FDA noted that some women in Perrigo's study had trouble understanding the drug's labelling information. In particular, the instructions warn that women with a history of breast cancer should not take the pill because it could spur tumour growth. And women who have unusual vaginal bleeding are instructed to talk to a doctor first, because it could indicate a medical problem.

;

;Perrigo executives said the company will spend the rest of the year manufacturing the pill and its packaging so it can be available in stores nationwide and online by early next year.
